intro: Stenogastra hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy stenogastra, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers make it distinctive, and it is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions. Stenogastra hirsuta is also valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture.
